data.enText: -ies
great suffering of the mind or body

data.chText: 名声只给她带来了痛苦。
data.enText: Fame brought her nothing but misery.
very poor living conditions

data.chText: 这里的人绝大多数生活在极度贫困之中。
data.enText: The vast majority of the population lives in utter misery.
something that causes great suffering of mind or body
the miseries of unemployment

data.chText: 老发牢骚的人；不痛快的人
data.enText: a person who is always unhappy and complaining
Don't be such an old misery!
make sb's life a misery
to behave in a way that makes sb else feel very unhappy
put an animal, a bird, etc. out of its misery

data.chText: 将动物人工致死以结束其痛苦
data.enText: to kill a creature because it has an illness or injury that cannot be treated
put sb out of their misery

data.chText: （告知情况以）消除某人的忧虑
data.enText: to stop sb worrying by telling them sth that they are anxious to know

data.chText: 别再让我着急了——我及不及格？
data.enText: Put me out of my misery─did I pass or didn't I?

simple_means.memory_skill: miser 可怜的 + y 表状态 → 可怜

ex.chText: 他生活在失业的痛苦之中。
ex.enText: He lived in the misery of unemployment.

ex.chText: 他们永远也不会忘记战争造成的苦难。
ex.enText: They would never forget the miseries of war.

synonyms.bx: 指由于贫穷、病痛等造成的痛苦。

ex.chText: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛使他难以入眠。
ex.enText: The agony of arthritis made him unable to sleep.

ex.chText: 她只好忍痛离开孩子们。
ex.enText: She had to go through the agony of leaving her children.

synonyms.bx: 指身体上的剧烈疼痛或痛苦的经历。

ex.chText: 人质的亲朋好友们经受着巨大的痛苦。
ex.enText: The loved ones of the hostages were going through anguish.

ex.chText: 失去孩子的巨大悲痛是难以承受的。
ex.enText: The anguish of losing a child was unbearable.

ex.chText: 那名士兵中枪了，整夜都处于痛苦中。
ex.enText: That soldier got shot and was in anguish all night.

synonyms.bx: 指精神或肉体上的极度痛苦。

ex.chText: 儿子的粗野行为使母亲深感忧虑。
ex.enText: The mother was in great distress because of her son's rough behaviour.

ex.chText: 那名妇女眼泪汪汪，显然很悲伤。
ex.enText: That woman was teary and clearly in distress.

synonyms.bx: 多指由于紧张、忧虑等造成的精神上的痛苦。

ex.chText: 难民们无法忘记战争造成的苦难。
ex.enText: The refugees could not forget the pain and suffering caused by the war.

ex.chText: 他认为我们不可避免地要忍受疼痛、疾病等身体上的痛苦。
ex.enText: He believes that we inevitably have to endure physical suffering such as pain, sickness, etc.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指精神或肉体上的痛苦、折磨。

data.enText: make sb's life a misery
to behave in a way that makes sb else feel very unhappy
put an animal, a bird, etc. out of its misery

data.chText: 将动物人工致死以结束其痛苦
data.enText: to kill a creature because it has an illness or injury that cannot be treated
put sb out of their misery

data.chText: （告知情况以）消除某人的忧虑
data.enText: to stop sb worrying by telling them sth that they are anxious to know

data.chText: 别再让我着急了——我及不及格？
data.enText: Put me out of my misery─did I pass or didn't I?

example: she was exhausted by her misery and grief

tr: a state of ill-being due to affliction or misfortune
example: the misery and wretchedness of those slums is intolerable

example.ex: All that money brought nothing but sadness and misery and tragedy.
example.tran: 那笔钱带来的只有伤心、痛苦和悲剧。

value.def: Misery is the way of life and unpleasant living conditions of people who are very poor.

example.ex: A tiny, educated elite profited from the misery of their two million fellow countrymen.
example.tran: 一小撮受过良好教育的精英分子从他们200万同胞的贫苦生活中获取利益。

value.def: If you say that someone is a misery, you are critical of them because they are always com-plaining.

example.ex: I'm not such a misery now! I gave up drink a few years back and that has changed things a lot.
example.tran: 我现在已经不喜欢抱怨了。几年之前我戒了酒，整个人就大不一样了。

value.tran: 牢骚满腹者;爱抱怨的人

value.def: If someone makes your life a misery, they behave in an unpleasant way towards you over a period of time and make you very unhappy.

example.ex: ...the gangs of kids who make our lives a misery.
example.tran: 弄得我们日子不得安宁的那几帮孩子

value.tran: 使生活痛苦;使日子不好过

value.def: If you put someone out of their misery, you tell them something that they are very anxious to know.

example.ex: Please put me out of my misery. How do you do it?
example.tran: 别让我着急了。你是怎样做的？

value.tran: (告诉某人其急于想知道的事)消除…的忧虑

value.def: If you put an animal out of its misery, you kill it because it is sick or injured and cannot be cured or healed.
value.tran: 将(动物)人工致死以结束其痛苦

partsOfSpeech.dec: com 加强 + miser 可怜的 + ate 做，造成，使… → 觉得非常可怜 → 怜悯
miser 可怜的 + able 可…的，能…的；具有…性质的 → 可怜的
miser 可怜的 + y 表状态 → 可怜
